meanings.definition: A plant of the parsley family with prickly leaves and small white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The eryngos in the garden have sharp leaves.
meanings.sent2: I saw beautiful eryngos blooming in the field.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got pricked by the eryngos while playing.
meanings.sent4: Her personality is like an eryngos, tough on the outside but delicate within.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the eryngos filled the air with freshness.

meanings.definition: The dried roots of the eryngo plant, used in medicine.
meanings.sent1: The herbalist prepared a potion using eryngos for the patient.
meanings.sent2: Eryngos are known for their healing properties in traditional medicine.
meanings.sent3: The wizard's potion contained powdered eryngos for magical effects.
meanings.sent4: In ancient times, eryngos roots were believed to have mystical powers.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the brewed eryngos roots was soothing and calming.

meanings.definition: A prickly or spiny plant resembling the eryngo.
meanings.sent1: The hiker avoided the eryngos look-alike due to its thorns.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the different species of eryngos and their relatives.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat got a surprise when it touched the fake eryngos.
meanings.sent4: The artist used the image of an eryngos doppelganger in her painting.
meanings.sent5: The garden was full of eryngos imitators, each with its unique charm.
